title: NASA Maintains ‘A’ for Investing in Small Businesses
summary: During an Investing in America event Tuesday with NASA leadership, the Small Business Administration (SBA) announced the space agency earned an “A” for the sixth consecutive year for its work with small businesses, exceeding its goals by 18%.

title: Electron launches seven smallsats in latest step towards reusability
summary: A Rocket Lab Electron rocket placed seven smallsats for three customers into orbit July 17 on a launch that also brought the company a step closer to reusing the rocket’s booster.

title: Young space firms are driving acquisition activity
summary: Young space companies made more acquisitions than their older peers over the last 12 months, according to analysis from British investment firm Seraphim Space.

title: UK Parliament Recommends Simplifying Launch Licensing Process
summary: The UK Parliament's Science and Technology Committee has recommended the simplifying of the launch licensing process for space companies operating within the country. The committee's proposal aims to facilitate the growth of the U.K.'s commercial space sector by reducing bureaucratic hurdles and ensuring a more efficient licensing procedure.

title: Virgin Galactic Announces Galactic 02 Crew
summary: Virgin Galactic is preparing to launch its send commercial mission, Galactic-02, and now we know who will be on board!
